article_title: Larry Jacobs: President Obama’s second term far from a dud

article_metadata.description: The two landmark bills that President Obama signed into law — the Affordable Care Act and the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform Act — both happened during the first two years of Obama’s tenure, when Democrats controlled both houses of Congress. Since then big ideas requiring big laws to achieve big goals have been stalled by partisan gridlock.

og.description: University of Minnesota political scientist Larry Jacobs argues that Obama has had a more consequential second term than any other president since FDR.
og.title: Larry Jacobs: President Obama’s second term far from a dud
